titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to require the establishment of procedures to assure that benefit payments will not be made thereunder to deceased individuals.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 4/22/1987--Introduced. Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act to require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to take affirmative measures to assure that OASDI benefits are not paid to deceased individuals. Requires, if practicable, that such measures include having State or local officials who are responsible for issuing death certificates or recording deaths periodically provide the Secretary with the names of the deceased within their jurisdiction.
